name: SerializedMessage
documentation:
Represents a fully serialized message for transmission or storage within the Fluxzero Runtime.

A {@code SerializedMessage} wraps the binary {@link Data} of a message payload, along with associated {@link Metadata} and optional routing and tracking information such as {@code index}, {@code segment}, and {@code requestId}.

This class is the wire format and persistence format for messages. It implements {@link SerializedObject} to expose type and revision metadata, and {@link HasMetadata} to allow downstream access to structured metadata.

Key Features

  • Encapsulates payload as serialized {@code byte[]} via {@link Data}
  • Immutable-style updates via {@code @With} for metadata, segment, etc.
  • Tracks message origin and target via {@code source} and {@code target}
  • Supports custom revision control via {@code originalRevision}, set before upcasting

Tracking Fields

  • segment – the segment of the message log this message belongs to (used for partitioning)
  • index – the index of this message in the log, used for ordering and deduplication
  • requestId – identifier that ties a response to its originating request

Typical Use

Serialized messages are produced by serializing a {@code Message} using a {@code Serializer}, and are then stored, indexed, transmitted, or routed based on metadata and log location. @see Data @see Metadata @see SerializedObject

fields.name: data
fields.documentation: The serialized representation of the message payload.

fields.name: index
fields.documentation: The index of the message within its segment. Used for message ordering and deduplication.

fields.name: messageId
fields.documentation: The unique identifier of the message.

fields.name: metadata
fields.documentation: Structured metadata associated with the message, such as headers or routing info.

fields.name: originalRevision
fields.documentation: If set, contains the original revision of the message prior to upcasting.

fields.name: requestId
fields.documentation: An optional request ID linking this message to a request-response interaction.

fields.name: segment
fields.documentation: The segment number for this message, used for partitioning and consistent hashing.

fields.name: source
fields.documentation: The identifier of the source that published this message.

fields.name: target
fields.documentation: The optional target ID that this message is addressed to.

fields.name: timestamp
fields.documentation: The timestamp when this message was created, in epoch milliseconds.

methods.name: getBytes
methods.documentation: Returns the length of bytes in the serialized payload. If the amount cannot be determined, {@code 0} is returned.

methods.name: getOriginalRevision
methods.documentation:
Returns the original revision of the payload object.

If {@code originalRevision} was explicitly set before upcasting, it is returned. Otherwise, the revision is delegated to {@link Data#getRevision()}. @return the original revision of the serialized payload
